• asm.js

    An intermediate programming language designed to allow computer software written in languages such as C to be run as web applications while maintaining performance characteristics considerably better than standard JavaScript.

  • WebGL 1

    A JavaScript API for rendering interactive 3D computer graphics and 2D graphics within any compatible web browser without the use of plug-ins.

  • Fullscreen API

    The API allows a single element to be viewed full-screen.

  • JavaScript
    Optimization

    Browsers have been optimizing JavaScript performance for more than a decade and that work continues today.

  • WebAudio

    A high-level JavaScript API for processing and synthesizing audio in web applications. The primary paradigm is of an audio routing graph, where a number of AudioNode objects are connected together to define the overall audio rendering.

  • IndexedDB

    IndexedDB is a low-level API for client-side storage of significant amounts of structured data, including files/blobs. This API uses indexes to enable high performance searches of this data.

  • WebSockets

    WebSocket is a protocol providing full-duplex communication channels over a single TCP connection.

  • Where we are today:

    In 2016, there is a culmination of technologies working in tandem to make web gaming higher performing and more accessible. And it's only going to get better from here.

    WebRTC Data Channels

    Enables peer-to-peer connectivity, which can provide lower latency: No intermediary server, fewer 'hops'.

    WebAssembly

    An evolution of asm.js which allows for a more compact binary representation, yielding lower file sizes and faster load times.

    WebGL 2

    An update to WebGL that tracks the more modern OpenGL ES 3.0 API, providing more power and flexibility for advanced 3D rendering on the web.
